metadata.name: OS Architecture Discovery Via Grep
metadata.comment: Detects the use of grep to identify information about the operating system architecture. Often combined beforehand with the execution of "uname" or "cat /proc/cpuinfo"

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/grep')) AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('aarch64')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('arm')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('i386')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('i686')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('mips')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('x86_64'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of grep to identify information about the operating system architecture. Often combined beforehand with the execution of "uname" or "cat /proc/cpuinfo"
